result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin B Coulman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber if imposed.
Consecutive to:
May transfer probation to the State of New York.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Restitution for Pinewood Creek Apartments. Paid in full.
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Violent Contact with the victim. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
May terminate probation after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. Surcharge is imposed.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Wolff.
letter from Kim Leiker, LMHC
NOTE:  ON 12/3/15, INCORRECT AMOUNT OF CASH BAIL TO FORFEIT WAS RECORDED AS "$1,500.00"

Defendant Justin B Coulman in court with Attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Wolff makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

30  DAYS HUBER   -  *consecutive*

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR  (May terminate after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent)  *CONCURRENT*  **TRANSER ALLOWED TO STATE OF NEW YORK**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No Use or Possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No Violent contact with: victim

RESTITUTION:  $550.00 to Pinewood Creek Apartments (to be paid out of cash bail posted)  NOTE:  Court re-instates cash bail and signature bond previously ordered forfeited  on 12/3/16 

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid out of cash bail posted)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**
2 victim impact statements filed by the state
Sentencing hearing at 03-18-2016 02:30 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Justin B Coulman in court with Attorney Peter M Wolff.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Counts #1 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Wolff requests a later sentencing date so Defendant can continue on obtaining residency in New York.  State does not object to an adjournment of sentencing.    Bail remains as fixed.   NOTE:  Court appoints Attorney Peter Wolff to this case and will allow Attorney Wolff's fees to be an hourly rate.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-17-2015 10:30 am

underlying case for bail jumping charge is Case #14CM2320
3/18/16 -  NOTE:  CORRECT AMOUNT OF CASH BAIL FORFEITED SHOULD HAVE BEEN $1,150.00 - Not $1,500.00

Case called at 8:55 a.m.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Justin B Coulman did not appear.   Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff does not know why Defendant does not appear today.  Court issues a capias.  Bail is ordered revoked and forfeited.
Hearing on December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin B Coulman in court with Attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff requests a jury status and jury trial date on Case #14CM2320.   Court sets this case over to status date on that case.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Justin B Coulman in court with Attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders Attorney's Wolff's extension of appointment for Defendant on this case.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED on all counts by Attorney Wolff.  Court sets bail.
